Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I asked about reward claiming in here before, but would I be able to get a channel created for discussing Ledger reward claiming progress and Qs? Ideally with me, James and a few other devs that know their way around the komodo codebase?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: here is fine

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: would be good to get a channel anyway to keep everything in one place, I'll probs come back with regular questions regarding the reward claiming

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: we hit a little road block with the app, it turns out the current official KMD app implements BTC consensus rule checks on the TX before signing

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: and having an output amount larger than the input amount violates this and causes the Ledger to throw an error

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
You can see the function here: https://github.com/LedgerHQ/ledger-app-btc/blob/master/src/btchip_transaction.c#L48-L71

For more context it's called from here: https://github.com/LedgerHQ/ledger-app-btc/blob/master/src/main.c#L1987

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I've "fixed" this with a pretty simple hack here: https://github.com/lukechilds/ledger-app-btc/commit/e2ebcada593710faf8f438bd26d21a170a3b60d4

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: it works, and bypasses the check for KMD

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: However the txfee amounts shown to the user now overflow for reward claim transactions

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
I wanted to implement the reward amount calculations on the device but:
1) It is completely incompatible with the current BTC protocol coin codebase
2) I'm almost certain Ledger won't accept a PR with all that code

The device has no concept of UTXO height or current block height, it just knows about inputs and outputs and signs them. So we'd need to completely fork the BTC app, add support for passing block height info to the Ledger, implement all the KMD interest consensus rules on the device, and then fork their API client and add the block height support to that too. :/

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so the current solution is preferable to that

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: just force allowing any output amount

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Just wanted your opinion on if this change is ok, I don't think it should have any negative effects

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: The only down side I can see is, if the outputs are larger than the inputs the txfee value overflows so it displays the txfee as like a bazillion KMD

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but that would only ever happen if the output amount is larger than the input amount

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: e.g with an reward claim TX

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: normal TXs will show up fine

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so no normal software is likely to encounter this

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: worst case scenario possible, someone accidentally crafts a TX that has way more outputs than inputs and sends it to the ledger to sign, the Ledger signs it without error, then they broadcast it to the network and it gets rejected instantly

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: no loss of funds

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: it will just sign TXs that break the consensus rules in the single scenario that the outputs are too large

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: _I think_

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but yeah, I'm a little out of my depth, I'm not very familiar with C at all

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so would be great to get your opinion on that

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: and also if you or anyone else can see an obvious way to not make the txfee overflow so we can show negative fees like on explorers rather that ridiculously high numbers that would be great too

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: At one time is was stated that "KMD will be the fuel for our upcoming Komodo Smart Contract API enhancements" Does this still hold true?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in order to do MoMoM cross chain CC, you will need KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and of course komodod is needed for all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is maybe more an indirect thing, like being on exchanges giving value to a coin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD being the core coin of the ecosystem gains value with each new ecosystem project, CC, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not a zerosum game

Author: yorklab#7270
Content:
I see . I asked because of this statement:

"Finally, UTXO-based smart contracts do not require ‚Äúgas‚Äù or any sort of fee for every process executed. Recall that the smart contracts and dApps built on Ethereum must pay for gas for every single process. This makes complex apps impossible."

Thanks for the reply.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I wont be adding in monetization in the code just for the sake of monetization. The key to mass market scalability is maximum value at minimum cost and if the cost is close to zero, even better. With millions of users in the ecosystem and all coins referenced against it, KMD is the main currency of the ecosystem. this alone is a big benefit as we see how BTC gains value as all is traded against it

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: I just want to make sure I can answer questions pertaining to KMD properly.  I don't want to give out false information.

Author: NedBGQ#8462
Content:
@SHossain @jl777c @grewalsatinder solution suggestion - not sure if anyone already suggested this OR if it is already in dev, but otherwise would be a neat addition to Komodo services portfolio. It's just a shower thought, perhaps suitble for a community discussion, cheers ----- 

Asking the real questions here...
‚óè How can an OTC trade of arbitrary size take place, in a
decentralized manner, w/o any escrows?
‚óè How can bids/asks be placed/taken with a *chosen*
party, w/o an intermediate, and risk-free?
‚óè How can this be realised with Komodo‚Äôs existing tech
i.e. within Komodo ecosystem?

Komodo‚Äôs OTC Dex

 OTX: an OTC Dex solution by Komodo

for: miners, shallow and deep pockets, and anybody seeking to do quick
business w/o going via exchanges with imposed (low) limits

 It would work in a similar way the BarteDEX does with
atomic swaps, but
‚óè Instead of waiting for orders to get filled in the usual way through order matching, an immediate trade on agreed upon price can take place, with tx-fees e.g. shared equally between the parties, or optional buyer/seller bears all fees
‚óè Each party has permanent account (name) linked to, perhaps, reputation or scoring mechanism with stated coins willing to do business in (KMD,ARRR,BTC,etc)
‚óè TX fees are perhaps only in KMD or BTC
‚óè Some simple chat function per transaction/trade, with downloadable/archiving function, available only to involved parties per tx, and/or sort of trade summary as with atomic swaps
‚óè Log in, check out currents offers on the board, sort by coin, contact the buyer/seller and do business
‚óè Coin not found? Place an offer or a request...
‚óè If trade agreed upon > initiate automated trustless exchange of funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: barterdex already has this pretty much possible. select a non-default netid get a bob node running as and FR node. then have alice connect to it and do the atomic swap

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: likely a GUI can automate most of this process

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but nobody I know of is working on this

Author: NedBGQ#8462
Content: thanks for the swift reply and the hint, did not know this- lately there are a lot of OTC activities related to ARRR, so, that why the suggestion

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: jawarrr is implementing a trusted node to do the escrow, but yest for non-PIRATE an atomic swap escrow that is easy to use would be the ultimate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: likely would be a good bounty for anybody that delivers this

Author: NedBGQ#8462
Content: but, instead doing a real atomic swap, a trustless exchange of funds as it is usually via OTC, woudl be a cool feature and perhaps a neat source of fees and exposure for komodo (marketing wise)...

Author: NedBGQ#8462
Content: anyways, thanks for looking into this, I appreicate it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its one of those things where all the difficult part are already done. just need somebody to put it all together
